titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eugene Victor Rostow papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:36

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings, printed material, newspaper clippings, photographs, and memorabilia documenting the professional and personal life of Eugene V. Rostow, Yale Law School professor and dean.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Eugene V. Rostow, 1979, 1981, 1984, 1990, and 2000. Gift of the Estate of Eugene V. Rostow, 2003. Transferred from the Yale Law School, 1982.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status of collection materials is unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eugene Victor Rostow Papers (MS 1024). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eugene V. Rostow (1913-2002) graduated from Yale College in 1933 and Yale Law School in 1937. During his career, he served on the law school faculty and as dean. Rostow also held various governmental positions including that of undersecretary for political affairs during the Lyndon Baines Johnson administration. He published widely in the fields of foreign relations and international security.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings, printed material, newspaper clippings, photographs, and memorabilia documenting the professional and personal life of Eugene V. Rostow, Yale Law School professor and dean.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material (1938-1959) is primarily correspondence to and from Rostow, from a variety of people and on a range of subjects. There are also small amounts of writings (speeches and reviews) and printed material (clippings). There is also one photograph of Rostow.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Received April 23, 1982 as transfer from the Law School.
